definition[0]: a group of things of the same kind that are very close together
example[1]: a cluster of low farm buildings
definition[1]: a group of people all in the same place
example[3]: A cluster of children stood around the ice cream van.
definition[2]: a group of sectors on one or more computer disks
definition[3]: if a group of people or things cluster somewhere, or are clustered somewhere, they form a small group in that place
example[4]: Reporters clustered around the palace gates for news.
example[5]: Industries in Britain tend to be clustered together.
